intro: Oiospermum nigritianum, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are typically harvested when fully mature. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Oiospermum nigritianum is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
